tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE IdentityTheftInformation (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    credit_card_number VARCHAR(16) NOT NULL,
    ssn VARCHAR(9) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE phishing_victims (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email_address VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE stolen_credentials (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    website_url VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    login_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    victim_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (victim_id) REFERENCES phishing_victims(id)
);

CREATE TABLE phishing_victims (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR,
    date_of_birth DATE,
    social_security_number VARCHAR,
    email VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE stolen_credentials (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR,
    password VARCHAR,
    website VARCHAR,
    date_stolen DATE
);

CREATE TABLE identity_theft_records (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    victim_id UUID,
    credit_card_number VARCHAR,
    address VARCHAR,
    phone_number VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE addresses (
    address_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id),
    street_address VARCHAR(100),
    city VARCHAR(50),
    state VARCHAR(2),
    zip_code VARCHAR(10)
);
